answers.q: is mineral oil good for your skin
answers.a: Yes—highly refined (cosmetic/USP) mineral oil is an effective occlusive that helps prevent water loss and soothe dry, irritated skin; it’s widely used and generally well tolerated.

answers.q: is mineral oil bad for your skin
answers.a: For most people it’s non‑irritating and non‑comedogenic, but heavy or frequent use can feel greasy and may trigger breakouts or folliculitis in some.

answers.q: what is mineral oil used for
answers.a: As E905a in foods, it’s used as a glazing/release agent and defoamer, and to coat items like confectionery or dried fruits and lubricate equipment.

answers.q: what is food grade mineral oil
answers.a: A highly refined, colorless, odorless “white” mineral oil that meets food-contact purity standards (e.g., USP/FCC with low PAHs) for use on or around foods; it’s used as E905a and to condition cutting boards and utensils.

answers.q: which is better saline or mineral oil enema
answers.a: Saline enemas are commonly first‑line for occasional constipation, while mineral oil enemas lubricate and are often used for hard or impacted stool.
